fr.iutvalence.java.projet.spaceinvaders
Class Movable

java.lang.Object
  fr.iutvalence.java.projet.spaceinvaders.Element
      fr.iutvalence.java.projet.spaceinvaders.Movable

public class Movable
extends Element

This class defines a movable object, that can move on a 2D grid and so being killed by others.
A movable object is characterized by its size and position on the grid and also its status [alive | dead]. Once a movable object is touched by another one, it's killed. The bounds of the 2D grid is defined in SpaceInvaders for, and movable objects can't move over without exception.

Author:
Gallet Guyon

public Movable(Coordinates i)
        throws NegativeSizeException
This constructor creates a new living Movable object taking its coordinates.
Size is set by the default couple of (10,10)

Parameters:
i - the initial position, as a Coordinate object
Throws:
NegativeSizeException - Throws Exception when the size coordinates are negative

               Coordinates j)
        throws NegativeSizeException
This constructor creates a new living Movable object taking its coordinates and size as parameters.

Parameters:
i - the initial position, as a Coordinate object
j - the size, as a Coordinate object whose x means width and y means height.
Throws:
NegativeSizeException - Throws Exception when the size coordinates are negative

The move method changes the position of the object (the size is unchanged).
It translates the coordinates by deltas given as x and y.

fire

public Movable fire(int direction,
                    Coordinates size)
             throws NegativeSizeException
Method to create new movable object who moves by itself in given direction [UP|DOWN]

Parameters:
direction - The direction of the shoot (if it negative the direction is down, up otherwise). If it's equal to 0 The function return null.
size - This defined the size of the movable object to create
Returns:
Return new shoot (Movable) or null if it failed.
Throws:
NegativeSizeException - If the size given is negative
